intro: Castilleja cervina, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and relies on other plants for some of its nutrients. The plant has bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. Castilleja cervina typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
